newsitem.title: USA: Royal Casino riverboat project advances.
newsitem.headline: Royal Casino riverboat project advances.

text.p: Royal Casino Group Inc said Tuesday the City Council of Wyatt, Mo., voted to annex the 50 acres of land on the Mississippi River under the company's control into the City of Wyatt.
Annexation of the land was one requirement that had to be fulfilled before the company could submit an application to the Missouri Gaming Commission for approvals and licensing of a riverboat casino.
Royal has been actively pursuing developing a riverboat Casino since January 1995.
In February 1995 the Wyatt City Council selected Royal to develop a Riverboat Casino Entertainment Center where the Mississippi and Ohio rivers meet.

Royal Casino entered into a definitive 25-year exclusive agreement with Wyatt in November 1995 to develop the Riverboat Casino complex. The following March, Royal entered into an agreement for 50 acres of land on the banks of the Mississippi River, and the next month it submitted an application for a docking permit to the US Army Corps of Engineers. Once Royal receives Corps approval, the company plans to submit its application for licensing to the Missouri Gaming Commission.

Royal operates Goldiggers Hotel & Gaming Establishment in Deadwood, S.D.. and has agreed to acquire the Triple J Casino in Henderson, Nev. Royal's application for licensing concerning this transaction is pending with the Nevada Gaming Commission.
